content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals sin squared t minus 1"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. For how many values of <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> does <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
